Define Documentation

#define NETIF_FLAG_BROADCAST   0x2U
 

if set, the netif has broadcast capability

Definition at line 56 of file netif.h.

Referenced by low_level_init().

#define NETIF_FLAG_DHCP   0x08U
 

if set, the interface is configured using DHCP

Definition at line 60 of file netif.h.

Referenced by dhcp_start().

#define NETIF_FLAG_LINK_UP   0x10U
 

if set, the interface has an active link (set by the interface)

Definition at line 63 of file netif.h.

#define NETIF_FLAG_POINTTOPOINT   0x4U
 

if set, the netif is one end of a point-to-point connection

Definition at line 58 of file netif.h.

#define NETIF_FLAG_UP   0x1U
 

whether the network interface is 'up'. this is a software flag used to control whether this network interface is enabled and processes traffic

Definition at line 54 of file netif.h.

#define NETIF_MAX_HWADDR_LEN   6U
 

must be the maximum of all used hardware address lengths across all types of interfaces in use

Definition at line 47 of file netif.h.

Function Documentation

struct netif* netif_add (  struct ip_addr *  ipaddr,
struct ip_addr *  netmask,
struct ip_addr *  gw,
void *  state,
err_t(*  init)(struct netif *netif),
err_t(*  input)(struct pbuf *p, struct netif *netif)
) 
 

Add a network interface to the list of lwIP netifs.

Parameters:
ipaddr IP address for the new netif
netmask network mask for the new netif
gw default gateway IP address for the new netif
state opaque data passed to the new netif
init callback function that initializes the interface
input callback function that...
Returns:
netif, or NULL if failed.
